website_summaries.verdict: The overall reaction towards the Inov-8 F-Lite 245 has been positive. This versatile running shoe is welcomed because it can apparently handle speed training sessions and gym workouts. Traction and foot balance are traits that can be appreciated from this product, as well.Fans of neutral running shoes that can handle both running and gym training can enjoy the Inov-8 F-Lite 245.
pros: The runners who have tested the Inov-8 F-Lite 245have noted that it has a lightweight build that accommodates all-day wear
According to some users, gym workouts can be enjoyed because of the steady platform design that welcomes lateral movements
The knitted upper unit of this Inov-8 running shoe is appreciated because it has a stretchy and form-welcoming structure
Based on a handful of reviews, the outsole is able to deliver responsible traction at all times
Some runners have noted that the forefoot has a broad construction that encourages balance
cons: A few people have claimed that the in-shoe experience is a bit restrictive
Some runners lament the too-close-to-the-ground midsole, stating that it doesn’t offer a lot of cushioning

customer_reviews.title: Regained Trust
customer_reviews.text: I was a fan of Inov-8 in the past. Iv'e owned multiple pairs of their shoes, but my favorite is the now discontinued 240s. These are the best Inov-8 shoes I've owned since them and are the closest feel to the 240s I miss. Inov-8 lost my favor when they started over-engineered their designs, but these shoes are good and show promise for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how it gets any better
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I put these on out of the box, they felt amazing. For functional fitness type activities, this shoe is so, so, so good. Comfortable, lightweight, room in toes (but not overly so), supportive, and look great. Other big name brands are just that, names. To those who know, Inov-8 is the real deal and these shoes in particular. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Family

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, very comfrotable
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of inov8 shoes for a few years now and these continue to impress me. For a lightweight shoe they are extremely comfortable, fit great, and look good too. I did buy these 1/2 size up from what I typically wear in boots and dress shoes but they are probably close to other athletic shoe sizes. I've only been wearing them for a couple of weeks now but the soles seem to be wearing well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: The Work-Out Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The only way to keep a work-out, is to feel good while exercising. The cushion on the feet is excellent. The size is made for a fat foot, even if the sizes is not 3x-wide, because it fits like a x-wide shoe. Was skeptical about the size, but this is the second shoe purchased, so knew it was a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! (May run small)
customer_reviews.text: I have two pair of 235 V2 and originally ordered the same size, to my surprise I had to return and order half size larger. My only complaint, great shoe nonetheless!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good overall shoe
customer_reviews.text: The 245 overall is a good shoe. Love the way it looks. The sole grips very well. The heel is nicely cupped in these. The shoe is a little stiff. I most likely won't run in these. Great gym shoe. The 230 v2 is more comfortable overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workout and running shoes for minimalist
customer_reviews.text: Had an older pair. Was glad to find new ones
customer_reviews.author: Jdickerson

customer_reviews.title: Like Foot Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and closest to the no longer available 195 lites. Will be buying another pair before these go away too!
customer_reviews.author: Jk47cares

customer_reviews.title: Inov-8.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of my favorite Inov-8s. These run a bit wider in the toe box compared to other models they sell. So I retuned my 12s and got an 11.5. I wear an 11 in Vans.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mansour

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is comfortable enough, but it's a little snug. I also doubt that this shoe will last the way my Nikes did. The tread isn't very deep, and the woven uppers are going to be susceptible to snags and tears.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: VERY pleased
customer_reviews.text: not a bit review writer, but the moment I put these shoes on I fell in love! I enjoy the minimalist type shoe and also do some lifting and plyometric exercises and these shoes preform as expected and also feel and look amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Ultra comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are ultra comfortable. The knit upper really distinguishes these shoes from others. Fit pretty true to size for inov8s.
customer_reviews.author: illFresh

customer_reviews.title: Best Inov-8s
customer_reviews.text: Best set of Inov-8's I've owned. Feel like a nicer fitting F lite 195.
customer_reviews.author: donald hollanx

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These Inov-8 shoes are light, comfortable, breathable, and look great. Construction quality is top notch. The knit texture of the upper is definitely unique and I love the khaki/green color. My feet measure a size 9.5 but I got a 10 in these and the fit is perfect; I would not want them any smaller. They offer good arch support. These are my new favorite workout shoes! I also have a pair of weight lifting shoes from Inov-8 and those are excellent too (again, I needed a half size larger), so I am definitely a fan of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: SnowedUnder

customer_reviews.title: A Great Sneaker But Pricey
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the quality and the fitting. I love this sneaker, it reminds me of New Balance that I used to wear all the time. This is light, breathable, and although not totally wide, but close to the wide size so it is really comfortable to wear. I primarily use this as a daily walker, but when I do run in it, it is so comfortable while "feeling" the ground as I run - feeling like "one with the road." The only issue is the price. Compare to similar products, it is about $15-$20 more expensive. Having said that I could confidently recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Aletheia

customer_reviews.title: Snug, but not uncomfortably tight, very light and good for general use
customer_reviews.text: I went running in these shoes and they felt wonderful. That's not always the case, even with shoes bought in the store that I've tried on! My size for running shoes is either 10 or 10 1/2, so these were snug but not crunching to my toes. I also have wide feet but the flexible fabric allowed for that. There might have been a bit more arch support and thickness on the soles, but the heel support was good all around, especially since I pronate (my foot rolls out as I run and it wears shoes on the outside edge). Very good value, don't know how long they will last, but they are very nice for now.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Ehrbar

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of lightweight running shoes. They have minimal heel lift which allows you to adopt a more natural running motion. Since I've switched over to zero drop shoes like these, I've had faster times and fewer nagging injuries. These shoes are well constructed and don't disintegrate over time like other running shoes. The style is simple and the no-slip tread provides you with superior traction. I use these both as regular runners and for family hikes. They are also attractive enough to be used as footwear during social gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: Peru Editor

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight, support is ok
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice mesh shoe. I kept this in my workout area to skip on as I exercise. The shoe is rather light weight and is very comfortable to wear. I do t use these as an every day, all around the place shoe because it doesn’t provide as much support as other shoes I have (eg Altra brand, which are much more expensive). Overall a great shoe for my needs. Good value. I hope this helps you.
customer_reviews.author: Soar

customer_reviews.title: Great Support with a Lightweight Design
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a unique fit that really works for cross-training. The heel, ankle and mid-foot fit snugly, then it spreads out in the front. It feels a little strange off the bat, but it turns out that this allows your foot to move the way it will naturally move during exercise. The sneakers are very comfortable, feel incredibly light, and provide solid support. They're a bit overpriced, in my opinion, but they're definitely well-designed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Very light shoes but do get half size up
customer_reviews.text: Very light pair of shoes. Feels like you are not wearing anything because it's so light. The width is narrow so feels a litte tight on both side. Length wise like many has mention do get half size up. For some maybe even one size up. I like my shoes with litte more cushioning on the bottom for running or even jumping. For the premiere price I would expect to be perfect but with length and width and less cushioning than I like I need to take one star off.
customer_reviews.author: Shark Bait

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is forever taking his shoes off - lack of comfort, too hot, too heavy - he has lots of excuses. Working on the farm, he felt he needed to wear boots or the equivalent, but then we’d discover him working barefooted. He loves these shoes - good for training, but great just for everyday chores - they have good structure for comfort, and the mesh keeps his feet cooler. Great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful  shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit true to size. They are stretchy enough and a good fit for a wider foot. Got hubs 15.5. His feet are big and wide, and he slid into them with ease. They have cushion inside, do not rub skin, you can wear them without socks. They allow feet to breathe and not get sweaty. They are well made with ribbed sole for better traction. The top is stitched while the sole is glued. Good looking comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Gerbera_Reads

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: These are truly very lightweight, I just feel a lot more free and fast when running as there is no added weight, great for me doing fast runs on a treadmill or working out. Probably wouldn't run a marathon in these as the soles are pretty thin but they really are nice to have around for wind sprints and quick workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Fighting Sioux

customer_reviews.title: New to this brand.....nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and comfortable. A very good fit too - may be just a little more narrow than what you'd expect, but not necessarily tight. If you NEED a wide shoe, then this will not be the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected. VERY lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely LOVES these shoes. He says they feel like a sock with a sole. No pressure points or rubbing at all. Let's your feet breathe and has great support.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good general purpose shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable general purpose athletic shoes. They are pretty comfortable. The uppers are cool. Sole is reasonably supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L. Katz

customer_reviews.title: For wide feet, Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the f-lite 235's V3 and had to send them back as they were too narrow, even though they are at the top end of Inov-8's width scale of 5. These f-lite 245's are wider, even though they are rated 4 in width. After a few box jumps, I'm mightily impressed with these f-lite 245's in terms of heel support and allowing the toes to splay. A good start :)
customer_reviews.author: Hugson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are plug and play. Put on for immediate comfort. Lightweight, true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver DeMille, TJEd

product_meta.title: Inov8 F-Lite 245 Training Shoes - AW20
product_meta.description: Inov8 F-Lite 245 Training Shoes The latest edition to our cardio category, the F-LITE 245 offers the ultimate in versatility, from functional fitness to running. A cardio masterpiece, constructed from highly flexible materials, this agile shoe weighing only 245g is designed to move freely with the natural movement of the foot. Inov8 Shoe Fit Scale For technical footwear, a good fit is essential to enhance your performance. Inov8's new Shoe Fit Scale makes it easier to find the perfect fitting shoe. All Inov8 shoes are designed with Met-Cradle technology to lock down the mid-foot for a stable hold, where they differ is in the toe box. The shoes are now graded from 1 to 5, Grade 1 representing their closest, most precise fit and Grade 5 representing the widest fitting toe box. The lower the number on the scale, the narrower the fit, which ensures minimal internal movement of the foot when running fast on technical terrain. Shoes with the higher numbers on the scale will suit athletes with a wider foot and those wanting that extra comfort in the toe box. This wider toe box allows the toes to splay for increased stability when lifting heavy weights. It's also perfect for longer runs and races when toes begin to swell. Inov8 have graded the F-Lite 260 Knit Training Shoes as Grade 4. Breathable Knit Upper The breathable knit upper offers exceptional breathability and ventilation to keep your feet cool and dry. By actively and efficiently wicking away the build-up of excess sweat and moisture, the mesh enables you to maintain both focus and performance as you strive for the best results. Once the sweat and moisture have been wicked, it is then transported from the skin to leave you feeling cool, dry and comfortable - ready to tackle the weight room and high-intensity exercises. In addition, the mesh encourages cool air to circulate, creating a drier, healthier environment for your feet to thrive in. The upper is extremely lightweight, yet durable to provide su
feature_bullets: ULTRA LIGHTWEIGHT - These sneakers are built using a lightweight mesh material so you can feel fast and free when you are running without any added weight, allowing you to move through your workouts with ease.
SUPER BREATHABLE - The lightweight mesh material makes it feel like you are not wearing anything and help keep the feet fresh and cool during the hottest summer weather.
STYLISH DESIGN - These stylish trainers are simply styled to work with all outfits and the knitted upper distinguishes the shoes from other cross trainers on the market.

COMFORTABLE SNEAKER - A minimally constructed upper fits the heel, ankle and midfoot snugly, whilst allowing more room for the toes to spread out in the forefoot. Plug and play for immediate comfort, our customers say the shoes fit true to size.

GENERAL PURPOSE SHOE - A super versatile shoe that looks attractive enough for general use and great as a minimalist workout and running shoe. One of the most runnable cross trainers there is out there.
